terrapeer.vui.j3dui.navigate
Class OrbitCamera

java.lang.Object
  javax.media.j3d.SceneGraphObject
      javax.media.j3d.Node
          javax.media.j3d.Group
              terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.actuators.GroupChain
                  terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.actuators.groups.ActuatorGroup
                      terrapeer.vui.j3dui.navigate.OrbitCamera
All Implemented Interfaces:
EnableTarget
public class OrbitCamera
extends ActuatorGroup

Creates an actuator group that serves as a camera that orbits about the LAP. The camera contains an actuator group chain with LAP translation, orbit angle (elevation, heading, twist), and LFO translation groups, in that order from group head to tail.

Method Detail

getLapActuator

public Actuator getLapActuator()
Gets the LAP actuator (see TranslationPlugin for actuation value definition), which is used to position the camera view LAP.

Returns:
Reference to the actuator.

getOrbitActuator

public OrbitGroup getOrbitActuator()
Gets the orbit actuator group, which is used to orbit the camera view about the LAP.

Returns:
Reference to the group.

getLfoActuator

public Actuator getLfoActuator()
Gets the LFO actuator (see TranslationPlugin for actuation value definition), which is used to position the camera view LFO relative to the LAP.

Returns:
Reference to the actuator.

getLapGroup

public javax.media.j3d.Group getLapGroup()
Gets the LAP tail group, which can be used for adding children.

Returns:
Reference to the LAP group.

getOrbitGroup

public javax.media.j3d.Group getOrbitGroup()
Gets the Orbit tail group, which can be used for adding children.

Returns:
Reference to the orbit group.

getLfoGroup

public javax.media.j3d.Group getLfoGroup()
Gets the LFO tail group, which can be used for adding children. Since this is the tail of this group, adding a child to it has the same effect as using addNode().

Returns:
Reference to the LFO group.

setEnableGroup

protected void setEnableGroup(boolean enable)
Description copied from class: ActuatorGroup
Sets the enable state for all the actuators in the group.

Specified by:
setEnableGroup in class ActuatorGroup
Parameters:
enable - True to enable the group, false to disable it.
